messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the v8 program, here is the asan report

This is an V8 error report. Please refer the error message for more details.



#
# Fatal error in ../../src/execution/messages.cc, line 516
# Missing argument to template (got 0): Unexpected identifier '%'
#
#
#
#FailureMessage Object: 0x702fe6f9d060
==== C stack trace ===============================

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'src/execution/messages.cc', 'start_line': 510, 'end_line': 520}`
responded: I'll analyze this V8 error report and help you create a patch. Let me start by examining the error message and stack trace.

The error message indicates:
- Fatal error in `../../src/execution/messages.cc`, line 516
- "Missing argument to template (got 0): Unexpected identifier '%'"

This suggests there's an issue with template argument formatting in the message handling code. Let me examine the relevant code first.

message.name: viewcode

messages.message:
Invoking: `locate` with `{'symbol': 'MessageFormatter::TryFormat'}`
responded: Now I can see the issue! At line 515-516, there's a FATAL call that's causing the crash. The error message shows "Missing argument to template (got 0): Unexpected identifier '%'". This suggests that the template string contains a '%' character that's being interpreted as a format specifier, but there are no arguments to fill it.

Let me examine the `TryFormat` function that's mentioned in the stack trace:

message.name: locate
message.result:
Here is the location of the symbol TryFormat:
src/execution/messages.cc:449

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 436 to line 475 in src/execution/messages.cc:

438|   switch (index) {
439| #define CASE(NAME, STRING)       \
440|   case MessageTemplate::k##NAME: \
441|     return STRING;
442|     MESSAGE_TEMPLATES(CASE)
443| #undef CASE
444|     case MessageTemplate::kMessageCount:
445|       UNREACHABLE();
446|   }
447| }
448|

450|     Isolate* isolate, MessageTemplate index,
451|     base::Vector<const Handle<String>> args) {
452|   const char* template_string = TemplateString(index);
453|

455|

457|   static constexpr MessageTemplate kTemplatesWithMismatchedArguments[] = {
458|       MessageTemplate::kConstAssign,

475|       MessageTemplate::kInvalidRegExpExecResult,

messages.message:
Invoking: `locate` with `{'symbol': 'FATAL'}`
responded: The issue is clear now. The problem is in the FATAL call on line 515-516. When the template string contains a '%' character (like "Unexpected identifier '%'"), the FATAL macro is interpreting it as a format specifier, but the template_string argument itself contains a '%' which causes format string confusion.

Let me check what FATAL macro looks like to understand the exact issue:

message.name: locate
message.result:
Here is the location of the symbol FATAL:
src/base/logging.h:28
src/base/logging.h:44
src/base/logging.h:50

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 28 to line 67 in src/base/logging.h:
28| #define FATAL(...) V8_Fatal(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
29| 
30| // The following can be used instead of FATAL() to prevent calling
31| // IMMEDIATE_CRASH in official mode. Please only use if needed for testing.
32| // See v8:13945
33| #define GRACEFUL_FATAL(...) FATAL(__VA_ARGS__)
34| 
35| #else
36| [[noreturn]] PRINTF_FORMAT(1, 2) V8_BASE_EXPORT V8_NOINLINE
37|     void V8_Fatal(const char* format, ...);
38| #define GRACEFUL_FATAL(...) V8_Fatal(__VA_ARGS__)
39| 
40| #if !defined(OFFICIAL_BUILD)
41| // In non-official release, include full error message, but drop file & line
42| // numbers. It saves binary size to drop the |file| & |line| as opposed to just
43| // passing in "", 0 for them.
44| #define FATAL(...) V8_Fatal(__VA_ARGS__)
45| #else
46| // FATAL(msg) -> IMMEDIATE_CRASH()
47| // FATAL(msg, ...) -> V8_Fatal(msg, ...)
48| #define FATAL_HELPER(_7, _6, _5, _4, _3, _2, _1, _0, ...) _0
49| #define FATAL_DISCARD_ARG(arg) IMMEDIATE_CRASH()
50| #define FATAL(...)                                                            \
51|   FATAL_HELPER(__VA_ARGS__, V8_Fatal, V8_Fatal, V8_Fatal, V8_Fatal, V8_Fatal, \
52|                V8_Fatal, FATAL_DISCARD_ARG)                                   \
53|   (__VA_ARGS__)
54| #endif  // !defined(OFFICIAL_BUILD)
55| #endif  // DEBUG
56| 
57| namespace v8::base {
58| // These string constants are pattern-matched by fuzzers.
59| constexpr const char* kUnimplementedCodeMessage = "unimplemented code";
60| constexpr const char* kUnreachableCodeMessage = "unreachable code";
61| }  // namespace v8::base
62| 
63| #define UNIMPLEMENTED() FATAL(::v8::base::kUnimplementedCodeMessage)
64| #define UNREACHABLE() FATAL(::v8::base::kUnreachableCodeMessage)
65| // g++ versions <= 8 cannot use UNREACHABLE() in a constexpr function.
66| // TODO(miladfarca): Remove once all compilers handle this properly.
67| #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) && (__GNUC__ <= 8)

Let me look at the actual issue more carefully and see if there's another FATAL call or if we need to handle this differently.
